intro: Liriosma singularis, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are small, clustered in spike-like inflorescences, and are usually white or pale green. Liriosma singularis is native to Central and South America but is now found in various tropical regions around the world.
